6e3ecbaa-29a5-4ba3-9e32-5a560770ea80.text: What is it, my brave leader?

desc.comment: на Лесной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем

(A1) 
(на Лесной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем)

f0088013-476b-46fe-93f1-53e03a6af766.text: ♩ In the pines, in the pines ♪ I love camping in the pines… ♫ Until the wolves go "Wooo", I'll love it in the pines… ♬ Until the night arrives, and I get mauled and die, and crows pluck out my eyes... I'll love it in the pines! ♪

326be21a-64a9-4e49-8a86-f3f5b0394e75.text: {?} I have a personal thing on my mind.

16da15a2-8ee5-4347-a0c4-c1d9eae23a8d.text: Oh, do you now? <With a coy smile, Liris waits for you to continue>

0b3add94-14ff-4104-bfca-e089508a5d7a.text: {!} I want you to have this as a gift... <Give Liris something you think she might enjoy>

17a8a93d-c24d-4aba-add3-c53a36436bac.text: Is this gonna be worth the dramatic buildup, or nah? Just kidding. You're so nice to me!

f019fec2-b20a-425a-a1ed-09aefb077f2b.text: {Pay} Check it out, it's an emerald. Almost as pretty as those eyes, Liris. I want you to have it, girl.

08dde3dc-2f0b-4c34-9e06-c42a28d7a5de.text: Y-you really think my eyes are as pretty as this gem? That’s… that’s so sweet. My dad used to say nice little fibs like that… but this one feels real. It means a lot, $PLAYER.NAME$. You’re the best buddy a girl could wish for.

24bfdb2d-f558-4fa2-b66e-18bfb1ecca71.text: {Pay} I found this gold ring. You should have it.

e1d826e7-527c-4d04-acb0-f199b80a2825.text: Oh. My. Gods. You *really* didn't have to do that. Yet you did. <Liris tries the ring on, hardly breathing from the pleasant shock> And it fits too! Thank you so much... Nobody ever treated me like this.

a47dfee0-58a0-4c69-9d90-d065878c75f2.text: {Pay} Keeping your hair so beautiful is probably a hard task. Maybe this comb will help?

a741e51b-a8de-4a80-b635-e195bfa1b1be.text: Aww, you really think my hair is beautiful? Thank you, thank you! <She runs the comb through her hair with a dreamy sigh> Mmm… cow bone. So fancy. You think of everything, don’t you, $PLAYER.NAME$?

eeff6f4b-49eb-4ee3-b58d-a616323b0173.text: {Pay} What do you think of this funnel cap? Pretty silly, right? Maybe I should just toss it...

aa30b577-2cd6-4bbf-a8c8-1d01ccfd8caa.text: Are you kidding me? This thing is amazing! <Liris snatches the funnel cap> I've only seen these things in paintings, and here's one someone actually made!

bec3d74f-20a2-49b2-a4ca-c4ef8743990e.text: Check this out. <She quickly puts the funnel cap on> Hurr-durr, I'm an alchemist, but truthfully I am but a quack and a fool, with my brain leaking out on account of me reading ancient lore all the time. Bwah-hah-hah! Hilarious. Thank you so much.

1e99a62b-c359-4c8c-9dd6-1d2bae822262.text: {Pay} I, uh... Found some strange seeds... You want them?

9593ab1f-c714-4531-ad11-a251629942a9.text: <Seeing the seeds in your hand, Liris breathes a sigh of relief> Oh gods, I'm so happy you're open-minded about Spekateya. So many people think we seed-chewers are losers and fiends… In fact, I only use this stuff recreationally, and I can quit at any time... Yeah, really.

d87a0b8f-13dd-45a2-91c2-0b7681cb0866.text: In fact, the health risks, mental damage, and risk of addiction are incomparable with those of booze consumption, and yet the law says booze is great, while Spekateja chewing is an offense in some counties. Can you believe this bull-shite, $PLAYER.NAME$?

97dc715b-67db-4081-ba7f-295c6a60451f.text: Outlawing a natural herb while encouraging the drinking of stuff that makes you violent, sick, and dumb? Disgusting. Chewing helps me relax, encourages spirituality, makes everything look funny, lets me unwind, while keeping or even heightening my reflexes.

e027038e-1102-457c-bb53-f5c64f614e0c.text: <She greedily throws a few seeds into her mouth, and keeps yammering while chewing> You know phwhat, $PLAYER.NAME$? We phshould campaign for phcomplete legalization of this stuff in Nova Drakonia when we have the time. Phfex phyeah, pffbaby! Ha... Haa-haa... Whee...

9fc0b308-5fd5-4f6c-8f9a-4c3623a1ecac.text: {!} Whoa, Liris, I ain't touching this issue with a ten foot pole.

e7b85fcf-6ca6-4a3b-95bd-fcba956135ab.text: {Pay} I noticed your ears are pierced. How about this earring I found?

f0ae8323-dee1-4f44-9596-f9e2c40754c6.text: <With a bashful smile, Liris quickly puts on the earring you gave her and spins in place, showing it off like a little twirling top, giggling all the while> I hope it looks cute on me, 'cause I’m never taking it off! Unless I get an infection, of course.

2394ed13-966d-4b86-9c35-54682c21c337.text: {Pay} Since we hike a lot, I thought I'd give you a pair of well-oiled boots.

9c403e5d-25f1-4588-b919-455b1a41ebe7.text: Ooooh, so sparkly and new! Don’t go staring at my feet now, you big ol’ sneak. <She pokes you in the chest in mock scolding, then quickly changes> Wow. I’ll wear them whenever I’m not off fighting beasties or tromping through the wilds. Thanks a whole bunch!

3029d0ff-0c47-4b95-b8bd-a8a35886560c.text: {Pay} Whoa, would you look at that turtle shell. Coarse on one side, smooth on the other. Sort of like us adventuring folks, eh? Take it.

9792bd7f-c7e8-488d-8e59-662ebd15d9b7.text: Oh my gosh, that’s just the sweetest thing ever! <Liris gives you a warm hug, pressing her petite frame against you> How did you know I love turtles? Now I get to keep a tiny bit of one with me forever and ever and ever… Tee-hee~!

d8592deb-ca3c-4658-9084-eed5634274b0.text: {Pay} Here's a cute lil' Pork Lad for you.

60bd74a7-8205-4294-8375-5b087302284e.text: Oh, $PLAYER.NAME$, is that a Pork Lad statue? <She smooches the crude wooden effigy on the snout> I had one just like this as a girl! Thank you so much, I love it! I'm cuddling with it every night from now on, splinters be damned!

7574a560-9c00-4e8b-af95-1dc068d3b7e2.text: {Pay} I plucked this red flower just for you. It's kinda neat, right?

e902abd1-9d65-4a9e-9ace-d0e571d74c91.text: Wow! A Dragonleaf? My favourite! Thank you so much, $PLAYER.NAME$! It will keep my diary extra fragrant, pressed between the pages. I'm gonna cherish it forever.

80357aba-f637-4cf5-bf12-e5212a31ead4.text: {Back} On the other hand, let's talk about something else.

1cff2d6f-3dc6-4abf-b6a5-99b6ffabdd56.text: You seem to know where you're going, and I'm happy to follow. Why stop and ask me for directions all of a sudden?

5f6818a0-3c82-41a7-9b26-59812fc9eb1f.text: After... after everything? <Liris backs away, dumbstruck, but quickly recovers> S-sure thing. I get it. If that's what you want...

f6567764-d71c-4e1d-8716-7543f514a9bd.text: In t-that case... <She covers her face, hiding fresh tears from your sight> I'll be camping out where we first met. If you still care enough to remember that place...

11f4e98e-b083-470e-86d8-d27dfaa19112.text: What a rotten trick to pull. I nearly believed you were through with me, too.

7889ca6e-9cba-4618-b3b7-4b5af2d6d6bb.text: Smell you later, as they say. <The girl giggles>

4aa0df5d-3b16-4f75-8e32-95ce6b5fa1fe.text: Our chats always boost my mood. So talk to me again soon, okay?

aaca4063-8756-4755-a578-9e951eec4da1.text: <With a coy little wink, Liris returns to business as usual—but the warmth of her loving gaze lingers on you a moment longer>

a96613fd-423b-4f0a-b8c2-99496c61bc3d.text: Love ya... <Liris softly whispers, as you part ways>

bc89c5d8-0cb5-42a2-8817-73e34b5293a9.text: And it was just getting good... <The girl pretends to pout>

d08e1a6e-7153-4535-8174-41122769594f.text: You wanna give me a gift? Aww. That's sweet of you.

762008ba-508d-4f85-be84-1df31110606f.text: You are spoiling me, and I'm having a hard time pretending I'm not totally into it. <Bites lower lip>

c6b14ead-6771-4b54-ad8a-96b0ae984c4e.text: You don't need to do that, $PLAYER.NAME$. You've already given me everything... <Liris gently embraces you and slowly, softly kisses you on the lips> You are the best gift a girl could want. Thank you for being here for me.

08965ee1-9952-4679-8508-59aa817e9abd.text: Hmm? Well, I enjoy your company, that's one fact I suppose I'm open to share. I just hope my skills are useful to you as well. A-are they?

753a7026-bad9-42e6-b036-8a627e49a269.text: That's good. I don't wanna be dead weight, you know?

e109ef7e-8c42-444d-a861-a40aac276fb5.text: {End} <Get back to what you were doing>

e2c9f8d6-4ac7-4ebf-8850-d573ea95fba7.text: {!} Of course, Liris. You are invaluable.

b601c185-71b1-49bb-aa81-98f3ca060496.text: You're just saying that! <Liris giggles, but still appreciates your kind words>

da240d4b-5ed1-41b3-aeb9-8adcd2fdc26d.text: {!} You need to do better, Liris. I don't have a place for those who don't give me their all. Are we clear?

f05cafd6-3d9e-456a-9c10-d756c45f876e.text: Well maybe you should get to know my talents before yap... No, you're right. <Liris stops, mid-confrontation, and hangs her head in shame> I will try to do better, I promise. Thank you for tolerating me the way I am.

fbd0613a-c99e-469a-afdc-f59c788f6186.text: <Liris nods slowly, and the two of you spend the next hour chatting about her life before she met you. She’s not exactly guarded—in fact, you learn all sorts of little things, like how green and red are her favorite colors, and how much she adores chewing seeds—but somehow, the conversation never quite drifts toward the eldritch stone or her family>

e7f87d2b-c00f-4994-8d31-3034f9f02d3c.text: <At first, the chat seems natural. But little by little, you begin to notice it: she’s gently guiding the flow, like a leaf floating down a stream, steering around anything she’d rather not share. Even so, it still feels like you’re growing closer—like you’ve been let a little deeper into her curious world>

13294d36-49e5-48f8-bdce-04a534674a36.text: <This time, Liris takes you on a little stroll to admire the local plant life. Flowers are sniffed, butterflies are chased, and pebbles are skipped across the water, all to the tune of her bright, bubbly giggles>

5fd69fa7-6a1d-4f7e-a574-bb7bd7dc077e.text: Whew! That was so much fun, $PLAYER.NAME$. It's nice to have a teeny break from all that endless trudging. We should totally do this again sometime… <She winks with a grin, then cheerfully returns to her usual companion duties—lugging your loot and keeping a sharp eye out for trouble>

ed8e97bf-928a-49ff-a5fa-c45ab76441c0.text: Wanna sneak off again? <Liris winks, biting her lower lip> If that's the case, I wanna see the starry sky.

c7aab110-b270-4d7f-b436-e360152d894f.text: {!} Can't afford that right now, Liris. You know we can't.

cf88acbb-cc66-4fd9-a4b8-b025b321f633.text: {End} Yeah. Next time, Liris. Next time.

616fedd5-a30b-4774-8c83-653dadddc3a4.text: <You set aside your current quest and sneak off to watch the stars—a rare guilty pleasure in the life of a busy adventurer. As soon as Liris spreads her cloak over the grass and the two of you settle in, eyes turned skyward, she starts naming constellations one by one, like she's introducing old friends>

cb1e8e44-c937-4cde-bf30-46151fa32b89.text: You’re way too down-to-earth for all this stargazing fluff—I can totally tell. But you still brought me here. Thank you, $PLAYER.NAME$… <Liris smiles warmly and gives your hand a gentle squeeze>

7de63807-a688-44eb-85cf-3cd4036596b6.text: But hey, enough of that nonsense. Let’s head back, $PLAYER.NAME$. <She stands, brushing off her cloak, looking for a moment like she’s just woken from a bittersweet dream>

a619acc4-3e90-414e-970d-02c91f58a345.text: This one’s called Aurox. See that tiny yellow dot, right where its eye would be? <She pauses, then speaks the name like it carries weight> Carcossa. The Xantous Abyss. That’s where folks who mess up in the Court of the Dragon get tossed for a deep cleanse, before they get reborn—usually as crabs or worms. Ew, right?

10b6ef51-b076-4910-abb4-1ccb2733d61b.text: {?} What are these four bright ones that form like a rhombus?

e53041e7-03ed-4485-8655-ff1a6c8a3927.text: Wait—you're telling me you don’t know about the Sister Stars? Cuz these are the Sister Stars, you big dummy! Witches and magi are always asking them for advice and secrets. Some folks say they’re not even stars at all… but let’s not go poking into that whole mess. Not tonight. Maybe not ever.

f5bc1540-88fb-42ca-b5a6-86c3a020bd4d.text: {?} What's the lonely red star over there?

f3518e88-d14b-49d5-b666-05bd46f734af.text: Oh, that’s not a star. It’s a flying ship from another world, packed with spooky people spying on us. Pfft—kidding! <Her sudden giggle startles you a little> It’s just a comet. A big ol’ rock zipping through space. Nothing to worry about. Unless it, y’know, crashes into us someday.

af9bf0d5-4aee-42ab-8647-8dccea7a563a.text: {?} How do you know so much?

b3e08a62-5143-4265-b29e-7525e7f1688d.text: Mom taught me all this stuff. When I was little, we didn’t have much to call our own. No sparkly jewels, no gold or pearls. But we had the road beneath our feet and the stars overhead. <Liris smiles, a soft glimmer of nostalgia in her eyes as she gazes into the velvet abyss above>

fee71acb-c1be-4dc8-ad23-a14d1b4adb92.text: Hey… I'm usually not that kind of girl… buuut… <With a naughty little grin, Liris shows you a cloth baggie filled with pipeweed> I picked some on the road. Wanna sneak off and smoke it? They say if you do it properly, you can see colors from beyond space, hear pixies sing, and eat twice your own weight in sweetrolls.

03ae44cd-b6e0-42df-834b-2e1182d818d8.text: {!} Absolutely not. I need my faculties right now, Liris.

52aa6ba3-228a-400f-99a1-8db5def2ea5f.text: Do you have to be so proper all the time? Eh, guess you have to. Leader stuff… <The girl winks, her disappointment already gone> But if you ever change your mind… you know who to call, yeah?

4d5ddbef-8ece-44ec-829a-94217d615a38.text: <The two of you make your way to a clearing just after sundown. There, Liris starts setting up for a cozy little smoke session… when suddenly, a mangy, disfigured feather-beast bursts from the nearby bushes, lunging at you with a horrible screech! Its claws gleam wickedly, ready to rend you limb from limb!>

49afec70-f830-4a0c-a7ed-ecc641f22cff.text: <You prepare for a mauling of a lifetime, but the creature drops mid-leap, crumpling to the ground dead before it even touched you. At that exact moment, Liris gasps—one of the tiny charms around her neck shatters in a puff of shimmering green smoke>

a992838e-3c58-4fa1-b34d-36e31556fbbf.text: Well, there goes another heirloom… Sorry, Dad. <The pale, trembling girl mutters, just as stunned as you are>

5ea196d7-8776-4f5f-9bfd-7ddbc3085214.text: Oh, calm your milk-makers, $PLAYER.NAME$. <Liris hisses, catching her breath> No witches or fae here. Just one of the many olden artifacts my dad smuggled back in the day—and the only one he bothered to pass on before vanishing. It was a relic… a tool, I guess. And now it’s gone.

a00bb31c-6cc7-4f9d-814a-d01cf3bf3f69.text: {?} A tool, eh? Nifty. Can you tell me more?

be2541ee-356a-412c-bb73-ff810be08a40.text: Just a single-use protective thingy. Probably the most basic, boring, everyday trinket to the goobers who made it. Only problem is—they lived here long before us humans figured out how to stand upright. So we can’t exactly ask 'em how or why it worked like it did.

9a3d4d3c-5c8e-4f89-848a-bf8c4c4a1475.text: Gods, that was scary. <You see her shiver and pull her cloak a little tighter> Can we go back to camp, please? No more talk. Not now.

72f81199-2fda-490b-b9a1-581b75841063.text: {?} Tool? Tool!? I don't need this shite! You get away from me. NOW!

d7d1f334-9ef1-47ca-bc25-f53c2f589e1a.text: After... after everything? <Liris backs away, dumbstruck, but quickly recovers> S-sure thing. I get it. If that's what you want...

705e484f-4e2a-4e86-be16-129616a3319d.text: {Ok} Of course that's what I want! Begone! Away with ye!

9c7253d5-fb1a-47eb-804a-11f59369e383.text: {No} Sorry... Sorry... I was just scared, that's all.

2f9447b3-cf42-42ba-baf4-1f813c03d261.text: Just one of the many olden artifacts my dad smuggled back in the day—and the only one he bothered to pass on before vanishing. It was a relic… a tool, I guess. And now it’s gone.

2b4fedf8-50bd-45e3-8dfc-101bbe8ef145.text: <You meet the beast’s snarling maw with a well-aimed crane kick—but it feels like kicking a wet sack of sand. The creature drops mid-leap, crumpling to the ground dead before it even touched you. At that exact moment, Liris gasps—one of the tiny charms on a string around her neck shatters in a puff of shimmering smoke>

d1ffd871-357a-4612-b602-df05277e40c8.text: Right. I suppose you wanna know about my dad now, don’t you? <Liris asks, reluctantly but resolutely. She’s ready to share her burden—this time, the full truth> My father… was a relic smuggler. The most professional one in all of Nova Drakonia.

1b5fefff-0c9f-4081-a100-278dfedcee6c.text: {?} No smuggler I've ever met had stuff that did what your charm did, Liris.

c582399b-a4a3-4453-96a7-c59545a7cbb8.text: Most of those doofooses just move shiny crystals around without a clue what they actually do. Not him though. He was… is... an educated fella. Knew how to use the stuff he looted from old temples and hidden vaults. Knew the words… That made them tick.

54ed1146-26bb-401a-a5af-2e9a1b8fe4ef.text: When my mom… got hurt in a deal gone bad… he quit trading. Said he’d use what he had to track down the rest—hide ‘em, break ‘em, whatever it took. Pulled me into it too. We worked together, until one day… he just didn’t show up at the meeting place. That’s my tale. I swear, that’s all.

c7d03fa5-62c3-446d-bb60-34486ffabda1.text: {!} Don't you worry, Liris. We're gonna find him yet. Together.

a1ca1bc2-21c2-453d-9c23-3ec86eeb9433.text: Thank you, $PLAYER.NAME$. Thank you for understanding. <Liris wraps her slender arms around you and buries her face into your neck. You don’t need to see her dainty face to know—she’s crying>

b0292a57-53af-436a-9004-09582ac8c566.text: {End} There-there, shorty... <Pat her on the back, gently>

4585a5e5-3919-43e2-a004-cf6fe5518eef.text: {?} And what does this Stone of Arkham has to do with the whole sordid affair?

031a890f-8c38-45a7-947e-9d86f820ba29.text: <Liris looks away, nibbling on her lower lip nervously> $PLAYER.NAME$... It took me so much to tell you what I did. I can't handle anymore. Not now, my dear friend.

dc6814d5-d006-42af-9c51-d290959506fb.text: {!} This is *WAY* too much trouble for my liking. Smuggling, artifact hunting, weird magics... We should split, Liris. For both of our sakes.

2637fd43-17de-4f28-a227-d708e93d6105.text: After... after everything? <Liris backs away, dumbstruck, but quickly recovers> Sure. I understand. Thank you... For what you did... I... We won't see each other again.

6da95680-495d-4d63-b244-5b79c8f012b3.text: {!} Yeah, bye-bye! See ya in the Abyss! Bye-e-e-e!

64da3e30-7aff-4a90-baed-41dd9ccbdd2d.text: Yeah. We really do need to talk, $PLAYER.NAME$. About this. <Liris produces the Stone of Arkham—the very object that started your journey together> I don’t think I’ll need it anymore. Just like I won’t need you to help me chase ghosts around Swordhaven again and again.

c256b681-8781-4852-8f9a-3d7d7cf24c7d.text: Among all the relics my dad left me, this one was actually the simplest. It’s one half of what’s called a Twinstone. Its only use is to let its holder feel if the other half is nearby. The other half of this stone was… embedded into my dad, through a kind of rite he did to himself.

b94f5537-2203-4d12-8465-f95a9acdfc75.text: {!} That's awesome! Let's go find your old man.

ebc2f651-12f3-4b79-b608-69305d7d7458.text: Well… <The girl lowers her gaze, and a soft sob escapes her lips> The only thing this stone has been letting me feel for a while now… is sorrow. Which means the other half is gone. Which means… I’ll never see Dad again. Which means… I don’t need to be escorted anymore.

4e65056b-5eca-4735-8b20-14d6709a7eea.text: {!} I don't care about that at all, Liris. I need you here, by my side.

4b3ac7b9-9831-4c99-837e-f5795831b489.text: Really? And why is that? <Liris asks, smiling with genuine curiosity, even as tears glisten in her eyes>

8729ccc4-30ca-45d7-8b41-c9e65d51f4b1.text: {!} Because I love you, baby girl.

0cdfec11-9322-4376-b6a8-db8925e19403.text: $PLAYER.NAME$… <Your words freeze her. Her lips tremble> I love you t-t—

b7d2c96c-6897-42e1-aed6-04a60ed2b582.text: {!} Say it, shorty. Say it like you mean it.

ee68ff27-970b-4b0d-b276-322e8554d7fa.text: <But instead of struggling to finish the phrase, she throws herself into your arms, clutching you like she’ll never let go, covering your face in passionate, searing kisses. Her tears flow freely now—no longer tears of sorrow and grief, but of joy. Pure, overwhelming joy>

1336b4d8-34f5-456f-8466-5bdbaf234746.text: {Action} <Kiss back> I will always be here for you, Liris. I will never let you go.

d9f33774-046a-4e8e-b690-ceb7c017ed95.text: <You don’t even know how much time has passed—only that the tears have all been shed, and every soft, tender word has finally been spoken. Still, the moment comes when Liris is ready to let you go. As she does, your eyes meet her sweet, loving smile> But that’s enough of that, eh? Come on then, $PLAYER.NAME$. Adventure awaits!

a0b80ef7-e8e7-4a75-9302-09562a2f518d.text: {!} Because you are a true friend.

c7179b13-9459-4ae4-b611-0346c6d7e267.text: $PLAYER.NAME$… you have no idea how much that means to me. I… I… <But instead of finishing the thought, she just holds you close, like she never wants the moment to end>

371a76a2-beff-41f4-a143-0661a9f068b9.text: {Action} <Pat her on the back> I will always be here for you, Liris. I will never let you go.

ffecefc2-216a-4ddd-83ef-8aec365b8b0f.text: {?} Well? What is it saying to you?

b91d9c51-4b50-48d5-9d64-345bdcfd7853.text: {?} What is this thing anyway, Liris?

59ede191-5bc1-46b8-9259-19bdb7da0c57.text: What's there to say, $PLAYER.NAME$? You already know everything I allowed myself to trust you with. $LOVE$ = love $GIFT$ = figft

24015e12-7edb-4465-aa76-a422b2e0592f.text: Aww, $PLAYER.NAME$, that’s so sweet of you—but you literally just gave me one! Not that I’m complaining—I love the attention. But if you keep pampering me so often, moments like this will stop feeling special...

desc.comment: на Лесной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем
на Горно-лесной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем

c93591e6-8434-4bf9-ab92-9662db10e7b3.text: Yikes. That’s a very long drop from these cliffs. So please, watch your step, okay? And if you do slip, maybe don’t immediately grab the nearest traveling companion as your personal safety rail?

84f22cdf-b8e3-47ec-be23-b5e1422fd384.text: Ughh… So flat… So open… Feeling vulnerable… Need tree cover, stat! The flowers are pretty, though. Maybe I should camouflage myself with a tasteful wreath?

desc.comment: на Равнинной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем
на Равнинной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем

481c787d-953d-4c94-97ca-dce789fd39ac.text: I hate fields. When I was little, a farm boy stole my Pork Lad. And the only thing I ever took from him… was a kiss. Tragic, ain't it?

на Болотной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем

(на Болотной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем)

992f81df-81f3-4fd6-8f0c-e3f2382e013d.text: It's dank, it stinks, but you have to agree, swamps are majestic, sort of. I wonder if we'll meet a kindly turtle! But that's just my empty stomach talking…

desc.comment: на Болотной Случайке. Включая обычные зедки и карту с лагерем

(A1) 
(на любой локации, которая не указана выше)

7161ed8f-5f8f-4511-bd85-9879b49160c8.text: Eh? I dunno. First time I'm seeing this place. Looks kind of lame.

3f081497-304d-4163-8eb8-b46673a5a008.text: This here's Smelters' Row! We're so close to Swordhaven proper, I can almost smell the clueless moneybags—ahem—I mean, the easily... mug-able snobs—ahem! I mean... folks! Regular, ordinary people! Yeah.

bf2d930d-9068-498e-ae46-eb525b7a92ba.text: These are the Swordhaven outskirts—which means we're just a few steps, a couple bribes, or... the occasional unsavoury favor away from waltzing right into the city proper!

54c2cf8f-c955-466e-b503-f43ef437afeb.text: That's a beautiful beach. Gods, I hope you didn't bring me here for a chance to gawk at my bare feet...

3e69f252-c8dd-410e-a5dd-8cd6dddac0e9.text: That’s a lovely beach. I do hope you didn’t bring me here for skinny-dipping, though. We're not quite there yet in our relationship, buddy.

f1941f66-5695-4927-907e-e286623fed00.text: Mmm... smells like lizard guts and hay, with just a hint of fishy sacrifice wafting in from that idol over yonder. Delightful. Thanks for the tour. You are a true friend.

6d80f808-1574-45a9-9309-f13369ab7469.text: It’s like whoever built this village was very new at the whole ‘village-making’ thing... Hope they improved with practice!

06703b8d-e7fa-4a25-a7c8-92c2757347af.text: You can almost smell the pain of folks who got jumped outta nowhere and crammed into this place like barn animals... I can see them now—trying to sneak past guards or make a break for wherever the confiscated gear ended up...

7e8b11bc-65ce-4e85-9959-607566bf13fb.text: This is Grainhold. Dad brought me here when I was a kid—crystal smuggling, old men wailing about hairy legs, stingy ferrymen, and bees. Oh gods, the bees. I got stung so many times trying to yoink some honey, I think I'm fully immune to their poison now.

desc.comment: в Спайдер Кейве. Снаружи и в Подземке

(A1) 
(в Спайдер Кейве. Снаружи и в Подземке)

58d3fd53-0b59-4b8f-90b9-48815a66dd81.text: Now why exactly did you bring me out here? You know I despise spiders. They’re, like, aggressively gross.

desc.comment: в Вайпер Шоале. Снаружи и в Подземке

(A1) 
(в Вайпер Шоале. Снаружи и в Подземке)

b8ecbc1c-ecb6-4366-ac7e-0abcd78a7f23.text: Ugh, can we please not waste time chatting right now? I can only pretend these snakes are wiggly strands of living rope for so long. After that, I’m basically self-destructing. From sheer terror, no less!

433525d8-cbd6-42a9-95bd-56429887fb19.text: Wanna know my opinion about this place, all mashed up into a single word? Here it is: "Ew". Makes my head hurt. Fingers crossed sweet old Viltyb brews up one of his vaguely effective anti-headache teas soon… wait—hold on, that doesn’t sound quite right—uhhh…

desc.comment: в Логове Снатчера. Снаружи и в Подземке
в Руинах Крессетвола. Снаружи и в Подземке

(A1) 
(в Руинах Крессетвола. Снаружи и в Подземке)

eaf8b106-0938-4243-8188-b27d11fc901e.text: Wow, faith really did move mountains back in the day. I mean, the first settlers hadn’t even finished slaughtering, looting and colonizing, and they were already throwing up monumental cathedrals like this one? That’s some prioritization.

desc.comment: в Руинах Крессетвола. Снаружи и в Подземке

5ba5e67c-c1bb-4746-b7d2-eab55ec95ba8.text: <You startle Liris, as she is staring off into the distance> Oh! Yes, $PLAYER.NAME$?

dacd7343-91d2-49f8-8644-117df0fd993d.text: Oh, dad... What were you thinking? <Liris notices your stare> I'm sorry. I was just... No matter. Did you want something?

1701e322-7df9-4908-bf81-b8249c12c888.text: Oh, hey! What's on your mind, $PLAYER.NAME$?

c3bd7e5f-8467-4bbf-805a-997394967528.text: <Sensing you are about to talk to her, Liris smiles shyly> Yeah?

89d57d9b-7b51-406b-90a8-c101f4f8a41f.text: <Liris meets your eyes with a soft, lingering gaze—quiet, hopeful, and shimmering with something unspoken> $PLAYER.NAME$?
